intro: Brachyelytrum erectum var. glabratum, commonly known as the smoothleaf brachyelytrum, is a species of flowering plant in the grass family Poaceae. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and narrow, smooth leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences bearing numerous tiny flowers. It is typically found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Its botanical features make it an important component of native plant communities in its range.
